hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout via 20D Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below 35% while its price consolidates within a 5% range for 10 consecutive days, a breakout above the consolidation high with >5% daily volume surge signals an imminent transition to a BULL regime, offering a high-probability long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves. A volume-confirmed breakout from such compression typically indicates accumulation and a shift in market structure. The current regulatory news cycle (MiCA, UK consultations) creates fundamental uncertainty that may resolve directionally.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) < 5% over last 10 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price appreciation from entry OR regime transitions to BULL (confidence > 70%) and holds for 3 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts (meeting all entry conditions) fail to sustain >5% gains or trigger a regime transition within 7 days.
